Cédric Beust ♔ wrote:

> On 8/25/06, Kevin Lawrence <kev.lawrence@... 
> <mailto:kev.lawrence%40gmail.com>> wrote:

>  > Setting a threshold that is not zero seems artificial and not very
>  > useful to me.
>  >
> 
> It can be...
> 
> TestNG lets you do this:
> 
> @Test(invocationCount = 1000, successPercentageCount = 90)
> public void foo() { }
> 
> ... which will invoke this method 1000 times and will only report a failure
> if more than 100 fail.
> 
> This feature was requested by users who do tests that are allowed to fail
> for a certain threshold, such as sending packets on an unreliable network.

It seems the context is different. The Original Poster appeared to be 
asking about failing a build only if, say, 5% of the suite's tests 
failed. That's quite a bit different from the feature you mention here, 
which would help with your example as well as statistical kinds of 
testing for randomness, that kind of thing.
